WRITING.TEXT: Bitches begone!

WRITING.TITLE: Website recommendations for buying Women #8217;s Renaissance costumes?
WRITING.TEXT: Hey everyone! I #8217;m going to Ren Faire in August. Last year, I made my costume and it was okay, but this year I #8217;ve saved up some money so I can buy a higher quality costume. I plan to spend around $200 or so. I totally understand that this will not get me the most elegant of costumes, but from what I #8217;ve seen, the costumes are this price seem decent. Other than Etsy, does anyone know any good websites to look for a costume/gown? I #8217;ve found a couple of costumes from medieval collector that I liked, but I #8217;m not sure if it #8217;s safe lol Thanks for your help!
I just ended up buying a dress from another Etsy store. But I #8217;ll be sure to keep your info on hand for the future!!

Overall, I think the plot is really good. If it didn't keep me engaged, I would've definitely have deleted the app awhile ago. However, I am finding chapter 3 a little slow in comparison to the previous chapters. Also, it's taken me months to get to where I am in the game despite playing daily. My facebook disconnected with the game once and reseted to the beginning. Luckily, I just logged into facebook again on the app and it had saved my data. If it didn't though, I don't think I would've wanted to start again because it takes soooo long to progress. Games that generally use the energy system are money pits and super slow. In order to keep playing, many people will spend a couple of dollars here and there to get more energy. Between classes, raising friendship levels, house cup, and the too cool for school events, I do feel like gems are much more accessible. I have spent gems on energy from time to time and have felt assured that I'll gain them back quickly. The clothing update was definitely one of the better updates. For the amount you've paid for the pet, I would appreciate a little more energy than just one energy point. Nonetheless, I think the updates are really just there to keep us engaged with the game. Especially because many are waiting for the next chapter to come up. The longer we have the app downloaded, the more likely we'll spend some sort of money on it.

Am I the only one who gets events late? Even though I check in daily, I feel like when the event popped up for me, I only had 5 days and some odd amount of hours left when it was supposed to be 7 days? I have the app on automatic update on iOS, but I also often check into the App Store to make sure that there's not an update waiting to be installed despite.

I ended up buying a red velvet and brocade dress from MajesticVelvets on Etsy. I thought it was super regal looking and I really liked that it came with sleeves. In comparison to some of the other more regal looking pieces on Etsy, I thought that the price seemed pretty fair even though it didn't come with a chemise and I had to pay a little extra for hemming and shipping. [Here is the link!](https://www.etsy.com/listing/453619762/julian-renaissance-red-brocade-red?ref=shop_home_active_65)
I agree! Initially I couldn't stand him, but I've grown to love him
Edit: Wow I #8217;m dumb... But that was pretty convincing lol

All of the above? I try to just write what comes to mind, but that's something that feels awkward. But at the same time I "edit" as I go, meaning, I go back and change things, add things, etc. However, if an idea, image, line a character speaks, or anything comes into my mind that I *really* want to incorporate in whatever I'm writing, whether or not it's time for that specific thing to occur, I hit the enter button and write it down. Then I go back and fill in the blanks, add things, take things out, and all of that blah. It's definitely all over the place. However, I do think the edit as you go method doesn't mean the piece is final. My pieces may be more put together than if I just straight up word vomited for a while, but they definitely need more editing. I tend to get caught up with minor, insignificant details and my grammar isn't fantastic at all times considering I'm normally half asleep while I write. Normally, I'll step away from the computer and come back to it later to then rehash it out and change anything I need to.
I probably haven #8217;t done it as frequently as I should, but yeah I #8217;ve had that happen too

While I think for many health care may be an issue, I think that anti-vaxers, in particular, have been sucked into thinking that doctors work for big pharma and are interested in their $$$ more than the well-being of their children. If you, as a parent, mistrust doctors, you #8217;re naturally not going to take your child to a doctor. Instead you #8217;ll do the next best thing, you #8217;ll post your child #8217;s symptoms on Facebook. /s Also, because of social media platforms, it #8217;s become like a contest of who can be the best parent. By posting that they didn #8217;t vaccinate jimmy or used EOs on Johnny #8217;s rash instead of taking him to the doctor, these parents feel like they #8217;re proving that they #8217;re good parents. They need validation that they #8217;re doing the right thing for their child. And they #8217;ll get back positive feedback by other parents, who are just as delusional and naive, which fuel other attention-seeking, misinformed parents to then act in a similar manner. The scary part is that these people think they #8217;re doing good for their children and humanity. I honestly do think that you make a good point that expensive healthcare may fuel some to skip doctor #8217;s visits. But I truly think that misinformation that spreads too quickly is also a key player in this twisted fad

I, too, was recently diagnosed. My mother #8217;s a dietitian, so with her help, I #8217;ve started to lose excess weight. These are just a few pointers that have helped me the most. Try to limit carbs, starches, and sugar intake and increase lean protein and veggies. You don #8217;t have to cut them out completely, but in moderation is best. If you eat the recommended portion size of any food, you should be okay. This may require you to measure out your food, but will prevent you from eating too much if you #8217;re anything like myself lol. I also try to substitute a lot of carbs for veggies. For example, if you like pasta, try zucchini noodles or a mix of zucchini noodles and pasta. A lot of #8220;healthy #8221; products, like protein bars, are filled with sugar. They #8217;re okay every once in a while, but if you #8217;re craving something sweet, it #8217;s better to grab a piece of fruit. Hard boiled eggs are one of my favorite go to snacks because they #8217;re filled with protein and are actually quite filling. Most importantly, try to eat three meals a day, especially breakfast. It #8217;ll jump start your metabolism and keep you more satisfied through out the day. Dizziness may come from low blood sugar. Eating smaller meals more often with some snacks may help you feel better. Drinking lots of water will help too! Hope this helps!

I experienced something very similar before I was actively seeking treatment for my anxiety and depression. Now from a healthier POV, I know it #8217;s because my parents were in denial that I was mentally ill and feeling helpless that they couldn #8217;t do anything to make me feel better. My mom told me once that she honestly thought I was a just bitch and didn #8217;t realize that the reason I would lash out or isolate myself was due to my anxiety. I had my therapist explain what was going on to my parents, and that helped tremendously. My parents couldn #8217;t see past the negative stigmas associated with mental health. They needed to hear it from a medical professional in order to understand that this is something their daughter was impacted by and everything would be okay with the proper help. My parents are now my number one support system. And though sometimes they get frustrated with my depression and anxiety when I just can #8217;t seem to push past it, they understand that I #8217;m trying my best. They want to provide the best support they can in the moment, even if they don #8217;t know how to help. I #8217;m in no means justifying what your mom said, but just know that she might be lashing out because of her own sense of helplessness. It #8217;s hard to understand mental illness unless you know what it feels like, and even then, so many people are in denial because they #8217;re afraid of being misunderstood or afraid their children will be misunderstood. Keep fighting, OP. It does get better. Don #8217;t feel guilty that you feel the way you do, but also know that you #8217;re capable of so much more than you know.

I like to tell my students that singing is a lot like running or any sport for that matter. If you want to run a far distance and well, it takes training and practice. You #8217;re not going to be able to run a marathon on the first day you start either. The fact of the matter is that it takes time, practice, and proper coordination of the muscles in order to be successful. Also, do NOT compare yourself to anyone! Everyone #8217;s voice is different and some people may catch on quicker than others. But that #8217;s okay. Hard work does and will pay off! A lesson teacher would be a great fit for you. It #8217;ll give you great foundation and provide exercises and things you can do to match pitch. A lot of time, singing is hard not because you can #8217;t hear the pitches, but you #8217;re having issues using the muscles to sing, and that #8217;s totally fixable.

WRITING.TITLE: I graduated college, I just want to sleep, and I feel awful for putting my boyfriend and parents through this
WRITING.TEXT: I don't typically post, but I think I just need to get this out. My freshman year of college, I was diagnosed with anxiety and depression. I learned how to cope with it within the context of college and living on my own. Now that I've graduated and have moved back home, I feel like I'm back at square one. My parents try to be supportive, but they don't quite understand how I'm feeling or why I'm feeling the way I do. I haven't had this many bad days in a while. I'm unemployed and I have no idea what I want to do with my life. I graduated with a Music Performance degree for voice, and although my parents are super supportive of me going and auditioning for musicals and things, I can't shake the feeling that I'm not good enough. I've considered just getting an office job or any job for that matter, but I don't know what I really want versus what my depression is preventing me from doing. Right now, all I really want to do is sleep all day, spend time in my room, and not talk to anyone. If no one wakes me up, I can easily nap for 4+ hours and still feel exhausted. I only have one good friend who lives in the area. We hang out as much as we can, but she's often out of town to visit her boyfriend. My friends from college live pretty far away, and my boyfriend lives about two hours away. I try to see them when I can, but it's tough. Especially when I've convinced myself that no one wants to see or deal with me. My boyfriend is super supportive, and has been there since the beginning. We were only friends when I was first diagnosed early on in college so he's seen me hit rock bottom and pick myself up. It was nice that when we started dating 5-6 months ago, I didn't have to explain that I have depression and all that comes along with it. Every once in a while, I'd have bad days here and there. Sometimes he'd come up to see me (we were only an hour away when I was in college) or he'd call me. He's really good at making sure I get out of bed, reminds me that my depression will make me think things that aren't true, remind me of my worth, etc. He always makes me feel better. However, with me being home and without a set schedule, my depression seems to have spiraled out of control, and I absolutely hate having to put him through this and see me like this. I'm embarrassed when I break down over silly, stupid things like looking in the mirror and being so grossed out by the way I look. Even now, he says just because I have bad days I'm not a miserable person, but I'm genuinely terrified of losing him. He's more concerned about my well-being more than anything, but I've had relationships fizzle out because I've pushed people away and I've never loved anyone more than I love him. He's never made a comment about it bothering him, but it still terrifies me. I definitely feel like I don't deserve him. I see a therapist and a psychiatrist regularly, and in the past, I've been really good about independently dealing with my mental illness, but I can't shake feeling guilty and awful for depending on him when no one else is around. Sorry for the long post, but it did help a bit just to get it out. TL;DR: I graduated college with a music degree, moved back home, and don't have a job. I feel depressed and just want to sleep all day. My parents don't understand depression. My boyfriend is a saint, and I don't deserve him.

First, Happy Cake Day! Second, don't be sorry for replying! It's somewhat relieving to know that you're not alone in feeling the way you do, especially when it seems like everyone you know doesn't experience that. When I was younger, summer months were definitely the hardest. It's easy to isolate yourself when no one's going out of their way to make plans with you.

Just know that you probably have more people on your side than you think. Depression makes it easy to isolate ourselves, think everyone hates us, and think that we're bothering others. I'm not sure that helps any, but keep pushing. It will get better, and don't forget that you do deserve to be happy and confident with yourself.

WRITING.TITLE: I cosplayed as Zelda for NYCC this past Saturday! I'm super happy with how it came out so I figured I'd share it here!

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you!
Thank you!
Haha thanks! I really liked it too! I actually ended up buying the costume because I am in no way talented enough to sew that, but the crown was something I found separately
